results.question: Spell this word backward (example: sun -> nus): Project
results.model_answer:
<reasoning>
To spell "Project" backward, I'll take each letter from right to left:
t -> first letter
c -> second letter
e -> third letter
j -> fourth letter
o -> fifth letter
r -> sixth letter
p -> seventh letter

Putting these letters together from first to last: tcejorP
</reasoning>

<answer>tcejorP</answer>

results.question: Spell this word backward (example: sun -> nus): Would
results.model_answer:
<reasoning>
To spell "Would" backward, I'll start from the last letter and work my way to the first:
d -> l -> u -> o -> W
Putting these letters together in this order gives me "dluoW"
</reasoning>
<answer>dluoW</answer>

results.question: Spell this word backward (example: sun -> nus): One
results.model_answer:
<reasoning>
To spell "One" backward, I need to:
1. Identify each letter from left to right: O, n, e
2. Write these letters in reverse order: e, n, O
</reasoning>
<answer>enO</answer>
